channel.title: Linux on Omri Bornstein
channel.description: Recent content in Linux on Omri Bornstein

item.title: Command-line Shell Configuration
item.description: This document summarises how I set-up my UNIX-like command-line environment (on Linux and macOS) for easier interaction with command-line interfaces (CLIs).

item.title: SHELL CTF How to Defeat a Dragon
item.description: Prompt # Dragonairre, the dragon with the hexadecimal head has attacked the village to take revenge on his last defeat, we need to get the ultimate weapon.

item.title: UACTF Sanity Check
item.description: Prompt # I didn’t know that strings was a command until way later LMAO.

item.title: raker
item.description: A social media scraper that is interfaced via a server-side rendered HTML user interface (or a CLI), and is managed by a REST API and a NoSQL database.

item.title: stalk
item.description: A cross-platform file-watcher that can run a command after each file-system operation on a given files or simply wait once until a file is changed.

item.title: cocainate
item.description: A cross-platform re-implementation of the macOS utility caffeinate that keeps the screen turned on either until stopped, for a set duration of time or while another process still runs.

item.title: FIT2082 Computer Science Research Project
item.description: As part of the FIT2082 unit, I contributed to an existing codebase, based on prior research by (Gange, Harabor and Stuckey, 2021) about Lazy CBS, their Multi-Agent Path Finding (MAPF) algorithm.

item.title: sp
item.description: My first attempt at building a Minecraft server plugin.

item.title: scr-web
item.description: My previous attempt at building a full-stack social media scraper, which is built with Angular on the front-end, and Nest on the back-end.

item.title: scr-cli
item.description: My previous attempt at building a CLI social media scraper, which is built with OCLIF.
